awd_titl_txt: Minority Graduate Research Honorable Mention:               Kathryn E. Nava
awd_abstract_narration: This special award will give graduate student Kathryn Nava                 additional flexibility in pursuing her graduate studies and research            initiation in geography.  The award will permit this student to conduct         field research in Costa Rica and Brazil and to attend a professional            meeting.  Her research will focus on the land- and resource-use                 decisions of farmers living in tropical forest reserves.                             This award grows out of a special program in the NSF Biological,           Behavioral, and Social Sciences Directorate to enhance the graduate             education of previous applicants for minority fellowships who were              awarded honorable mention ratings.  This award should strengthen                research participation in geography and regional science by a promising         student who is a member of an underrepresented minority group.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
